page.syntax: PNG as B = BITMAP_TO_PNG(B bitmap_data[,C flags[,C backgroundcolor[,C text[,B alpha_bitmap_data]]]])

argument.name: flags
argument.description: Optional. Allowable values are:"G" = gray, "R" = RGB, "A" = RGB with Alpha mask, "I" = Interlaced. Character

argument.name: alpha_bitmap_data
argument.description: Optional. The bitmap to use as an alpha (transparency) mask.

page.description: Convert bitmap(s) to a PNG bitmap, flags 'G'ray, 'R'gb, 'A'lpha-rgb 'I'nterlaced.
page.discussion: The BITMAP_TO_PNG() function converts a Windows Bitmap (BMP) file to Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format .
page.example: dim ff as P dim bb as B dim cc as C ff = file.open("C:\Documents\Xbasic Reference\Images\logo.bmp",FILE_RO_EXCLUSIVE) bb = ff.readb(100000) cc = bitmap_to_png(bb, "R")
